name: cloudcode
description: Duet AI + Tools for Google Cloud

cloudcode.project.description: The Google Cloud project used by Cloud Code for viewing and interacting with project resources

cloudcode.debug-kubernetes.description: Provide customizations for the Cloud Code debuggers.

suppressNETCoreWarning.description: If true, suppress .NET Core debug warning.

suppressJavaWarning.description: If true, suppress Java debug warning.

suppressPythonWarning.description: If true, suppress Python debug warning.

suppressNodeJSWarning.description: If true, suppress Node JS debug warning.

suppressGoWarning.description: If true, suppress Go debug warning.

configPath.description: Full path to the KubeConfig file.

cloudcode.kubeconfigs.markdownDescription: List of KubeConfig files that can be used in the Kubernetes Explorer. Switch between the default KubeConfig and KubeConfigs listed here with the `#cloudcode.active-kubeconfig#` setting.

items.description: Tag for the emulator image from gcr.io/apigee-release/hybrid/apigee-emulator

cloudcode.apigee.emulators.description: List of emulator tags to be enabled in the emulator view

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables to be attached, key is the variable name to be exported and the value represents the variable's value

detached.description: Should the container be started in detached mode

privileged.description: Should the container be started in priviledged mode

labels.description: Labels to be assigned, where the key represents label name and the value label's value

volumes.description: Disk volumes to be mounted, where the key represents the host path and the value represents the path mounted in the container

additionalArguments.description: Additional arguments to be added to the docker run command (separated by space)

cloudcode.active-kubeconfig.markdownDescription: Name of the active KubeConfig used by the extension. This name should match the name of a KubeConfig stored in `#cloudcode.kubeconfigs#`. If a name isn't provided, the default KubeConfig will be used.

cloudcode.kubectlExecShell.markdownDescription: The shell to use when choosing 'Get Terminal' on a Pod in the Clusters Explorer. Commonly used choices include `sh` or `bash`.

cloudcode.kubectlRequestTimeout.description: The length of time to wait before giving up on a single kubectl server request. Non-zero values should contain a corresponding time unit (e.g. 1s, 2m, 3h). A value of zero means don't timeout requests.

cloudcode.samplesBranch.markdownDescription: Branch to checkout from Google-maintained code sample repositories.

cloudcode.enable1stPartyAuth.markdownDescription: Enable authentication using 1st party authentication. gcloud will be used to sign in if this setting is set to false and may require additional dependency to be installed.  **Changing this setting requires a reload of vscode. [Click here](command:workbench.action.reloadWindow) to reload**

cloudcode.beta.enableSkaffoldModules.description: Enable the new Skaffold modules integration for kubernetes applications.
cloudcode.beta.enableSkaffoldModules.deprecationMessage: This is no longer a beta feature

cloudcode.beta.enableBuildEnvironmentsIn.description: Enable setting up Build Environments on run/debug/deploy sessions.
cloudcode.beta.enableBuildEnvironmentsIn.deprecationMessage: This is no longer a beta feature

cloudcode.beta.enableSendLogs.description: Enables the ability to send logs on crashes and failures.

cloudcode.beta.enableGettingStartedPage.markdownDescription: Enable the Getting Started with CloudCode page

cloudcode.beta.skaffoldSubmitLogsFailure.markdownDescription: Enable submitting deployment logs on Skaffold errors of these types

cloudcode.beta.enableGcloudOnDemand.markdownDescription: Enable Installation of GCloud on demand

cloudcode.beta.enableListnrOnly.markdownDescription: The config key to route all Cloud Code feedback to Listnr

cloudcode.enableMultiSkaffoldConfigsKey.description: Enable support for multiple skaffold configurations.

cloudcode.enableTelemetry.markdownDescription: Enable sending usage data to Google. Data collected is subject to the [Google Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy).

cloudcode.updateAdcOnLogin.markdownDescription: Append a `â€”-update-adc` flag to `gcloud auth login`. [Read about this flag](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/auth/login#--update-adc).

cloudcode.updateChannel.markdownDescription: Automatically install the insiders version of Cloud Code by changing this value to 'Insiders', or set the value as 'Default' to use the stable released version from the marketplace. [Learn more about Insiders builds](https://cloud.google.com/code/docs/vscode/insiders).

cloudcode.enableMinikubeGcpAuthPlugin.markdownDescription: Enable the [minikube gcp-auth plugin](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/handbook/addons/gcp-auth/) when starting a Cloud Code run or debug session that is deploying to minikube.

cloudcode.enableConfigLessExperience.markdownDescription: Enable the experimental config-less run/debug experience for Kubernetes and Cloud Run apps.

cloudcode.yaml.trace.server.description: Trace the communication between VSCode and the language server in an output window.

cloudcode.yaml.schemas.description: Associate schemas to YAML files in the current workspace.

cloudcode.yaml.format.enable.description: Enable default YAML formatter. **Changing this setting requires a reload of vscode. [Click here](command:workbench.action.reloadWindow) to reload**

cloudcode.yaml.format.singleQuote.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.

cloudcode.yaml.format.bracketSpacing.description: Print spaces between brackets in objects.

enumDescriptions: Wrap prose; if it exceeds print-width.
Never wrap; keep prose on the same line.
cloudcode.yaml.format.proseWrap.description: Choose when to automatically wrap prose.

cloudcode.yaml.customTags.description: Custom tags the parser should recognize and validate against.

cloudcode.yaml.clusterResourceCompletion.description: Enable resource completions from the active cluster. This setting may impact completion performance.

cloudcode.yaml.yamlFileMatcher.markdownDescription: Glob pattern matching YAML files in the workspace. YAML editing support such as completion, inline definitions, and linting would be available for this file type. Read more about glob patterns [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_advanced-search-options).

cloudcode.yaml.kubernetesVersion.description: Select the Kubernetes version Cloud Code should utilize when providing YAML editing support.

cloudcode.yaml.crdSchemaLocations.markdownDescription: Array of locations pointing to Kubernetes CRD schema. Each of these can be set to a local path (example: `/files/crd.yaml`) or URL (example: `http://github.com/user/repo/crd.yaml`).

cloudcode.cloudshell.project.markdownDescription: Default project to use in Cloud Shell. If not set, the existing default will be used or you will be prompted to set one. For more information on how to get started with developing in a Cloud Shell environment, view this [quickstart](https://cloud.google.com/code/docs/vscode/quickstart-remote-dev). This will also set the cloudcode.project setting to the same value.

cloudcode.autoDependencies.markdownDescription: Automatically install and update required Cloud Code dependencies such as the [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud), [Skaffold](https://skaffold.dev/), [minikube](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/), and [Kubectl](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/overview/).

cloudcode.verboseLogging.description: Display extension debug information in the 'Cloud Code' output window.

cloudcode.cloudSdkVerbosityLevel.description: Display Cloud SDK debug information in the 'Cloud Code' output window.

repoUrl.description: Git path pointing to the repository

localPath.description: Folder where the sample repository has been stored locally

cloudcode.customApplications.description: List of custom samples in Cloud Code

cloudcode.useGcloudAuthSkaffold.markdownDescription: Use gcloud authentication for skaffold deployment

cloudcode.enableGkeAutopilotSupport.markdownDescription: Enable deployment support for GKE-Autopilot clusters

cloudcode.enableCrashReporting.description: Enable reporting unexpected Cloud Code crashes to Google

cloudcode.showWelcomeOrReleaseNotes.description: Enable displaying welcome and release notes on first use of cloud code and subsequent updates.

enumDescriptions: Never show progress indicator while scanning for vulnerabilities.
Only show progress indicator on first scan for vulnerabilities.
Always show progress indicator while scanning for vulnerabilities.

cloudcode.sourceprotect.policy_location.description: Path to project policy config file. This path may be relative to the workspace or absolute. Can also be a URI (http://xxx, gs://xxx)

gcloud.description: Filesystem path to the Google Cloud CLI.

cloudcode.dependencyPaths.markdownDescription: Filesystem paths to the binaries Cloud Code has a dependency on. If not set, Cloud Code will attempt to find the binary in the `PATH` or use the managed version of the binary, depending on the value of the `cloudcode.autoDependencies` setting. A path must include the `.exe` extension if on Windows.

cloudcode.duetAI.enableSalesBlurb.markdownDeprecationMessage: Determines if the Duet AI sales blurb should be shown on the welcome page when Duet is disabled.

cloudcode.duetAI.enable.markdownDescription:
Enable Duet AI for developers.  Duet AI in Google Cloud is your AI-powered collaborator, so you can accomplish tasks efficiently. Duet AI does not use your prompts or its responses as data to train its model. [Learn more](https://cloud.google.com/duet-ai/docs/discover/data-governance)

**Note:**  Changing this setting requires a reload of vscode. [Click here](command:workbench.action.reloadWindow) to reload.

cloudcode.duetAI.enableChat.markdownDescription:
Enable Duet AI Chat.

**Note:**  Changing this setting requires a reload of vscode. [Click here](command:workbench.action.reloadWindow) to reload.

cloudcode.duetAI.project.markdownDescription: The GCP project to use when sending requests to Duet AI

cloudcode.duetAI.inlineSuggestions.enabl.markdownDescription: Enable automatically providing inline suggestions. If set to false, inline suggestions can still be obtained manually with the 'Trigger Inline Suggestion' command (creating a keybind is recommended).

cloudcode.duetAI.languages.markdownDescription:
The list of language identifiers to request inline completions.

**Note:**  Changing this setting requires a reload of vscode. [Click here](command:workbench.action.reloadWindow) to reload.

cloudcode.compute.sshInternalIp.description: Connect to Compute instances using their internal IP addresses rather than their external IP addresses. Use this to connect from one instance to another on the same VPC network, over a VPN connection, or between two peered VPC networks.

language.description: Programming language of the application being debugged.

debugPort.description: Debug Port used on the container.

remoteRoot.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program
remoteRoot.default: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

podSelector.description: Selector to choose debugging pod. Usually a dictionary where key is app and value is the name of the deployment will suffice. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/ for more information.

localRoot.description: Path to the local directory containing the program

containerName.description: Name of the container to be debugged. This field will only be used if more than one container is found in the pod.

skaffoldConfig.description: Path to the skaffold configuration file used for running the app.

profile.description: Name of the skaffold profile. Remove this field to use the default profile.

imageRegistry.description: Image registry to push the container images to. For example, gcr.io/{Google Cloud Project ID} or docker.io/{Repository Name}

watch.description: Watches for changes in the workspace and re-runs the application. Defaults to true.

cleanUp.description: Deployed kubernetes resources will be cleaned up after the application is terminated. Defaults to true.

autoStop.description: Minikube clusters started automatically by Cloud Code will stop after the user is done with the extension. Defaults to true.

portForward.description: Forwards ports for exposed kubernetes resources on the cluster to your local machine. Defaults to true.

resourceDeletionTimeoutMins.description: Timeout in minutes for skaffold to wait on resource deletions before redeploying.

image.description: The name of the container image.

sourceFileMap.description: Path mapping used by the debugger. The key is the local path and the value is the path on the remote container.

debug.description: An array of image names and their respective source paths mapped from a local source. Any additional fields will be passed along to the respective language debugger. For example, justMyCode for the Python debugger.

language.description: Programming language of the application being debugged.

debugPort.description: Debug Port used on the container.

remoteRoot.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program
remoteRoot.default: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

podSelector.description: Selector to choose debugging pod. Usually a dictionary where key is app and value is the name of the deployment will suffice. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/ for more information.

localRoot.description: Path to the local directory containing the program

containerName.description: Name of the container to be debugged. This field will only be used if more than one container is found in the pod.

protocol.description: Node.js option: debug protocol to use

justMyCode.description: Python option: debug only user-written code.

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Run/Debug Kubernetes App
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for running or debugging an app on a Kubernetes cluster

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Attach (NodeJS) to k8s Pod
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for attaching a debugger to a kubernetes pod (NodeJS)

body.name: Attach to Kubernetes Pod (NodeJS)
body.remoteRoot: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Attach (.NET Core) to k8s Pod
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for attaching a debugger to a kubernetes pod (.NET Core)

body.name: Attach to Kubernetes Pod (.NET Core)
body.remoteRoot: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Attach (Java) to k8s Pod
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for attaching a debugger to a kubernetes pod (Java)

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Attach (Python) to k8s Pod
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for attaching a debugger to a kubernetes pod (Python)

body.name: Attach to Kubernetes Pod (Python)
body.remoteRoot: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Attach (Go) to k8s Pod
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for attaching a debugger to a kubernetes pod (Go)

body.name: Attach to Kubernetes Pod (Go)
body.remoteRoot: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

cpu.description: Container CPU limit. Limit is expressed as a number of CPU. Fractional CPU limits are allowed (e.g. 1.5).

build.description: Build Settings. Specify one of [docker, jib, buildpacks].

buildArgs.description: Arguments passed to the docker build

jibMaven.description: Builds image using the Jib Maven Plugin

path.description: Build file path. Ex: pom.xml, .mvn directory

jibGradle.description: Builds image using the Jib Gradle Plugin

path.description: Build file path. Ex: build.gradle, gradle.properties, settings.gradle or the Gradle wrapper script (gradlew, gradlew.bat, or gradlew.cmd)

buildpacks.description: Builds image using Cloud Native Buildpacks

target.description: Target to run the app. Only minikube is currently supported.

watch.description: Watches for changes in the workspace and re-runs the application. Defaults to true.

autoStop.description: Minikube clusters started automatically by Cloud Code will stop after the user is done with the extension. Defaults to true.

sourceFileMap.description: Path mapping used by the debugger. The key is the local path and the value is the path on the remote container.

externalPortForward.markdownDescription: When this is set, Cloud Code will port forward a version of the service to `0.0.0.0` so it is accessible to other devices on the network. This is useful for debugging your service on mobile devices.

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Run/Debug Cloud Run App
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for running and debugging a Cloud Run app locally

functionName.description: Name of the function to be deployed. (Name must start with a letter followed by up to 62 letters, numbers, hyphens, or underscores and must end with a letter or a number)

region.markdownDescription: The location this function will be deployed to. **Region can only be set at creation time.**

gen.markdownDescription: `GEN_1` or `GEN_2`. [Click here to see differences between Gen 2 and Gen 1 functions.](https://cloud.google.com/functions/docs/concepts/version-comparison)

revision.description: The revision of the locally downloaded Cloud Function.

runtime.description: Runtime for the function. Can be changed after deployment.

entryPoint.description: Entry point to your code, e.g. the exported function name.

directory.description: The subdirectory in this workspace containing the function.

testInput.description: The test input for the Cloud Function

walkthroughs.title: Customize Cloud Code Sidebar
walkthroughs.description: Customize the views that appear in the Cloud Code sidebar

steps.title: Unified activity bar
steps.description: All explorers are consolidated into a single Activity bar icon.

steps.title: Use the Project Selector status bar item
steps.description: The project selector in the bottom status bar applies to all Cloud Code explorers.

media.altText: New Project Selector status bar item

steps.title: Hide and show explorer views
steps.description: The top Cloud Code More menu (three dots) lets you choose which views are shown.

steps.title: Rearrange views
steps.description: You can drag explorers to reorder them in the Cloud Code activity bar.

steps.title: Move a view to other activity bar
steps.description: You can drag an explorer to a different activity bar to create your own layout.

media.altText: Move a view to other activity bar

walkthroughs.title: Code with Duet AI
walkthroughs.description: Boost your productivity and code quality with Duet AI

steps.title: Connect with Google Cloud
steps.description:
Connect your Google Cloud account to access the AI powered features and get the most out of your development experience.
[Connect](command:cloudcode.walkthrough.signin)

media.altText: Connect with Google Cloud via the Cloud Code status bar

steps.title: Connect with Google Cloud
steps.description:
Connect your Google Cloud account to access the AI powered features and get the most out of your development experience.

__$(check) You are signed in__

media.altText: Connect with Google Cloud via the Cloud Code status bar

steps.title: Activate Duet AI
steps.description:
To activate Duet AI in your IDE, you need to select a Google Cloud project with the Cloud AI Companion API enabled

Duet AI doesn't use your prompts or its responses as data to train its model.

You must [connect with Google Cloud](command:cloudcode.walkthrough.signin) to set a project.

media.altText: Activate Duet AI to begin using Duet AI features

steps.title: Activate Duet AI
steps.description:
To activate Duet AI in your IDE, you need to select a Google Cloud project with the Cloud AI Companion API enabled.

Duet AI doesn't use your prompts or its responses as data to train its model.
[Select Google Cloud Project](command:_cloudcode.duetAI.setProject)

media.altText: Activate Duet AI to begin using Duet AI features

steps.title: Code Generation
steps.description:
Duet AI improves your code quality and saves time by autocompleting code. It can generate code based on natural language descriptions and help you learn new programming languages. [Learn more](https://cloud.google.com/code/docs/vscode/write-code-duet-ai?_gl=1*ry39ax*_ga*MTY4MjQ1NDk1My4xNjkzMjQwMDMw*_ga_4LYFWVHBEB*MTY5MzMzMjk0OC4xLjEuMTY5MzMzMjk2NC4wLjAuMA).**
[Open Settings](command:_cloudcode.duetAI.openConfiguration)
__**Tip:** Use keyboard shortcuts to accept code suggestions.__

steps.title: Chat with Duet AI
steps.description:
Duet AI is capable of holding conversations, answering questions, and generating content to improve your coding experience.
[Open Chat](command:_cloudcode.duetAI.focusChat)

media.altText: Duet AI brings chat to the IDE

walkthroughs.title: Duet AI in Apigee
walkthroughs.description: Duet AI in Apigee is a powerful new tool that can help you create API specifications from scratch in seconds.

steps.title: Start with Duet AI
steps.description: Click the Start with Duet AI button to load the generative AI tools.

steps.title: Enter your prompt
steps.description: Provide a few details about your API, such as its name, endpoints, and methods, and Duet AI in Apigee automatically generates a complete API specification.

steps.title: API design experience
steps.description: Use the Duet AI in Apigee API design experience's powerful tools to review the API, including a code editor with inline code assistance and quick fixes, and an API visualization panel.

steps.title: Quick actions
steps.description: Once you are satisfied with your API specification, Duet AI in Apigee provides quick actions to help you move your API from design to production, such as registering to API hub, testing with a mock server, and more.

commands.title: Open Google Cloud CLI Install Guide
Set up Kubectl Proxying for cluster
Grant private GKE nodes outbound internet access
Diff Current JSON/YAML File with K8s Deployed Resource
Create Kubernetes Resource from Current File
Apply Current JSON/YAML File to K8s Deployed Resource
Run App on Local Cloud Run Emulator
Debug App on Local Cloud Run Emulator
Open Cloud Code Status Bar Menu
Add Version to Secret in Secret Manager...
Sign Out of All Accounts in Google Cloud SDK
Sign Out of Google Cloud SDK
Learn how to create a policy file
Add a Cluster to the KubeConfig
Export test resources to Apigee Emulator
Set up test resources in Apigee Emulator

viewsWelcome.contents:
Replatform applications to containers on GKE.
[Install tools](command:cloudcode.migrateToContainers.installTools)
[Edit tools paths](command:cloudcode.migrateToContainers.editToolsPaths)

Replatform applications to containers on GKE.
[Edit Sources](command:cloudcode.migrateToContainers.mfit.editSources)
